events.title: Implementation of the Gregorian Calendar
events.description: In countries adopting the Gregorian calendar, October 15 followed October 4 directly to correct calendar drift.
events.significance: This reform standardized the calendar used by much of the world and corrected inaccuracies in the Julian calendar affecting date accuracy.

events.title: Discovery of Penicillin
events.description: Alexander Fleming discovered the antibiotic substance penicillin, the first true antibiotic, which would revolutionize medicine.
events.significance: Penicillin's discovery marked the beginning of modern antibiotics, significantly reducing deaths from bacterial infections.

events.title: Launch of the USSR's Luna 12
events.description: The Soviet Union launched Luna 12, an unmanned spacecraft that orbited the Moon and sent back high-resolution photographs.
events.significance: Luna 12 contributed valuable lunar reconnaissance data during the early space race between the US and USSR.

events.title: Black Monday Stock Market Crash
events.description: Stock markets around the world crashed, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average falling over 22% in a single day.
events.significance: This was one of the largest single-day percentage declines in stock market history, leading to significant economic reforms.
